messages: cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:34): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: can html5.org please link to the tracker?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:39): i wonder if the requirement that <script src> elements must be empty is helpful or not
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:40): i've seen pages that use comments in <script src>, either <!--pseudo-comments--> or /* js comments */
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:41): It keeps the future open for allowing something there?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:42): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: But that'd need be defined in HTML 2œÄ, so requiring it to be empty in HTML 5 changes nothing
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:42): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: i don't think so -- html4 allows stuff there and people don't care whether the spec allows it or not anyway
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:42): really hopes the next revision _is_ 2œÄ
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:43): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: what would you allow there in the future anyway?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:44): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: Nested script elements for fallback
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:44): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: that doesn't work in legacy browsers so not particularly good fallback story
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:45): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: <script type=unknown>..</script> <script> fallback </script> works
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:45): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: Not if you support both scripts
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:45): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: they might be able to communicate with each other
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:45): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: so the new script can set a flag that it has executed
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:45): That's a big might
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:46): maybe but <script type=unknown> .. <script> fallback </script> </script> is guarenteed to *not* work
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:47): You're nesting the wrong way
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:48): Old browsers ignore the contents, so they use the outer element's src. New browsers check the contents for another script element and use that if possible
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:48): nesting doens't work either way
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:49): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: script is cdata parsing, can't have elements in there at all. changing that would break legacy content
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:49): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: That might hurt with <script language=unknown>/* legacy content */ document.write('<script>'); </script>
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:50): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: This is only with @src
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:51): i'd rather design a new script language for the web in such a way that it's possible to communicate with javascript
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:52): (like flash can communicate with javascript, at least i think it can)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:52): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:55): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: in practice, authors just put harmless stuff in there and the validator will complain about it, and they have to move the comment out of the script element, which seems pointless

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:56): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: moreover, if the legacy script is external, why not let the new script be external too and have another attribute for the new script?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:56): <script src=fallback newsrc=new>
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:56): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: And duplicate all the other attributes as well?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:57): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: what other attributes?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:58): You'd want type, to make sure you actually support the new script.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:59): you know you support it since you support the newsrc='' attribute
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:00): of course this doesn't scale to many new scripting languages
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:00): btw, can vbscript talk to javascript?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:00): Well, yeah, if you make one new src for each language, that'd work, but that's kinda crazy :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:01): let's solve this problem when a new scripting language actually is introduced :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:02): But until then, keeping our script elements neat and tidy doesn't hurt :P
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:03): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: whenever you're bored enough, could you dig for data about pages that use <script src>..nonwhitespace..</script> ? :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:09): btw, <script src=my-interpreter id=myscript>my custom syntax script</script> could work
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:10): instead of <script type=my/custom>syntax script</script> <script src=my-interpreter></script>
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:12): although i guess that's less intiutive and so authors don't do it anyway, so might be pointless to allow it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:35): I would guess the most common case of content in srced scripts is when people write <script src="..." />[rest of page content]
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:37): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i guess it would be interesting to know how common that is too :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:38): wishes Eclipse didn't crash immediately after loading
